content: The US Treasury building in Washington, DC. content: By Jaspreet Kalra MUMBAI(Reuters) -The Indian rupee lumbered in a tight band on Wednesday, holding above its all-time low even as the U.S. dollar continued to charge higher, with traders pointing to likely central bank intervention to support the local currency. The rupee closed at 88.7975 against the U.S dollar, a whisker away for its all-time low of 88.80 hit last week but little changed on the day.
